fields.description: Delete all objects/folders (non-background task version) wireframe available at https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=19857431

comments.body:
[~zhill]: After a discussion during today's UI team weekly meeting, we will likely require multi-delete support in Eucalyptus to handle a "delete all items in this bucket" operation via the console, due to the latency incurred with each request if there are thousands of keys in a given bucket.  What are the chances that multi-delete could be available in the 4.1 release?

/cc [~decker], [~jloza], [~shashi]]

[~kgill], it is a less-than-sprint sized task. We can get to it. Does it block your progress to not have it by the end of Sprint 4? I can get it in Sprint 4 but we've got Ceph tasks for QA integration that need to be done first so other than "the end of Sprint 4" it's hard to give a firm commitment on a time.

[~zhill]: Understood.  If we can't have it by the end of Sprint 4, we may need to punt on the "delete all items in this bucket" operation to post 4.1.  Deferring to [~jloza] and [~shashi] on the priority though.
[~kgill], I'm with you on this plan. "Delete all items in this bucket" will be a big boost to usability, but that shouldn't come at the cost of Ceph integration related tasks. Thanks.

It is a usability loss for sure, but I am sure that S3 console support is not as high of a priority as ceph for the storage team. Perhaps we can do something on our side, [~kgill]? 

Maybe there's a number we can do without requiring a background task, that wouldn't be too reasonable to ask the user to wait on, and if the count is higher than that, disable the button, or have it work on chunks at a time? 

For example, perhaps we could run some tests on how long it takes to delete 100, 250 and 500 items, and see if we can find a reasonable chunk there that we can control by the button? That way we can get better usability than single delete, while we are waiting for the back end team to implement multi-delete. Let's talk later.

[~jloza]: I recommend we display the "you cannot delete a bucket with one or more objects…" (or similar) warning for now.  We really need multi-delete support in the backend to make this work, and any other solution would be a suboptimal hack IMO.
[~kgill] we already have that warning if there are objects int he bucket. Ping me in IRC and let's discuss on a gchat or something.
[~kgill], I'm going to get a start on this since I've freed up. Let me know if you have any concerns. I've discussed some options with Jenny
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/908
UX review passed, needs code review
[~jloza]: Just a heads up that pull request 908 has changes from GUI-1207 as well, so we'll need to wait until https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/905 is merged before reviewing PR 908.
Ah, OK, thanks, [~kgill]. That ticket just got moved to [~dkavanagh] for code review so hopefully it can get merged soon. :)
1207 is merged! This is ready for review.
reassigning for one more quick UX check
need to implement delete folder and delete object singletons. Looks awesome otherwise!
branch updated... going through CI tests.
UX review passed. Ready for code review.
Pull request 908 merged

[~dkavanagh]: I'm working on GUI-1207 and am seeing some strange behavior when attempting to delete a folder with non-alphanum characters.  I receive a success notification when deleting a folder, but when I refresh the page the folder remains.  I'm seeing the issue with the eucalyptus/admin account on latest develop, using clchost = 10.111.5.17 when attempting to delete a folder with a special character (e.g. folder "3&foo=bar").
[~kgill], it's certainly possible that something needs escaping.
[~dkavanagh], [~alice]: We may need additional work here, since the delete objects operation doesn't appear to remove all associated artifacts (e.g. versions, delete markers) in a bucket/folder.
moving out of QA for handling delete objects/folders/all objects and folders when buckets are versioned.
GUI-1322 opened to track changes to delete bucket for versioning. Moving this ticket back to QA
